Description: Rim and body sherd of small Silhouette Style Corinthian pottery kotyle (kotyliskos); interior: glazed (fired brown); exterior: frieze of irregular vertical strokes (debased sigmas) between narrow bands; below, frieze of water birds, possibly ducks in silhouette style marching to right with dots and dashes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 219)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 95, no. A132, pl. LXVIII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.315) (phase 3)
